questions.question_text:
A company is evaluating Microsoft's virtualization services.
Which feature is unique to Windows 365?

discussion.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-365/enterprise/provisioning

Provisioning in Windows 365 is the automated process that:

Creates a Cloud PC virtual machine.
Sets it up for the user.
Completes other tasks that prepare it to be used.
Sends access information to the user.

So E is correct for this one

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-365/enterprise/provisioning >> so E
Then, users who have a Windows 365 license and match the configuration details will automatically have a Cloud PC provisioned for them. Provisioning is a one-time per user and per-license process. Any given user and license pair can only have one Cloud PC provisioned for them.

questions.answer_description:
Windows 365 is a cloud-based service that automatically creates a new type of Windows virtual machine (Cloud PCs) for your end users. Each Cloud PC is assigned to an individual user and is their dedicated Windows device. Windows 365 provides the productivity, security, and collaboration benefits of Microsoft 365.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-365/overview

choices.E: A virtual machine is automatically provisioned after assigning a license to a user.
choices.B: Users can connect to a virtual machine by using a web site.
choices.A: Users can connect to a virtual machine by using the Microsoft Remote Desktop app.
choices.D: A virtual machine can be provisioned from a custom image.
choices.C: A virtual machine can authenticate users to Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
